intro: Erigeron obtusatus, commonly known as the bluntleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a blunt or rounded tip, giving it its common name.
